qas.question: What languages use extrapositioning in sentences less than Catalan?
What do you not need to use in Catalan?
What languages use the passive voice more than Catalan?
What method does Spanish use to identify the object?

context: This flexibility allows Catalan to use extraposition extensively, much more than <a0_0>French or Spanish<a0_0/>. Thus, Catalan can have m'hi recomanaren ("they recommended me to him"), whereas in French one must say ils m'ont recommandé à lui, and Spanish me recomendaron a él. This allows the placement of almost any nominal term as a sentence topic, without having to use so often the <a1_0>passive voice<a1_0/> (as in <a2_0>French or English<a2_0/>), or identifying the direct object with a <a3_0>preposition<a3_0/> (as in Spanish).
